intro: Saccolabium suffusum, commonly known as the pink sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a perennial herb characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Saccolabium suffusum is part of the Malvaceae family, which includes other flowering plants with similar structural features.
